conclusion: Square coil with n turns and side length a
Half of the coil is in a uniform magnetic field
The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the coil
The magnetic field intensity increases uniformly from B to 2B over time Δt
We need to find the induced electromotive force
Recall Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction: The induced electromotive force (emf) ε is given by ε = -dΦB/dt

premise: ΦB = ∫B ⋅ dA; For a uniform field perpendicular to the coil, ΦB = B ⋅ A_effective
conclusion: Since only half of the coil is in the magnetic field, A_effective = 1/2 ⋅ a^2

premise: ΦB = 1/2Ba^2; For n turns, Φ_total = nΦB
B changes uniformly from B to 2B over time Δt
